title: COMISS â€” Compare Scalar Ordered Single-Precision Floating-Point Values and Set EFLAGS

fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`COMISS xmm1, xmm2/m32`
`VCOMISS xmm1, xmm2/m32`
`VCOMISS xmm1, xmm2/m32{sae}`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: Compares the single-precision floating-point values in the low quadwords of operand 1 (first operand) and operand 2 (second operand), and sets the ZF, PF, and CF flags in the EFLAGS register according to the result (unordered, greater than, less than, or equal). The OF, SF and AF flags in the EFLAGS register are set to 0. The unordered result is returned if either source operand is a NaN (QNaN or SNaN).

fields.name: ​
fields.value: Operand 1 is an XMM register; operand 2 can be an XMM register or a 32 bit memory location.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: The COMISS instruction differs from the UCOMISS instruction in that it signals a SIMD floating-point invalid operation exception (#I) when a source operand is either a QNaN or SNaN. The UCOMISS instruction signals an invalid numeric exception only if a source operand is an SNaN.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: The EFLAGS register is not updated if an unmasked SIMD floating-point exception is generated.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VEX.vvvv and EVEX.vvvv are reserved and must be 1111b, otherwise instructions will #UD.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: Software should ensure VCOMISS is encoded with VEX.L=0. Encoding VCOMISS with VEX.L=1 may encounter unpredictable behavior across different processor generations.

fields.name: C/C++ Intriniscs
fields.value:
